column27: and thinner.  There is a five gallon limit per person and paint may be taken from the Paint Swap area.  Do not mix materials together.  Please keep materials in their original container and mark the contents if the label is illegible.  This site does not accept evaporated paint.  If the latex paint can is less than half full
column28: dry it out with kitty litter and then throw it out with the trash.  Give all items to an attendant.  Tires and auto batteries are collected in the Spring and Fall
column29: please watch for dates or call 781-794-8237 for alternative drop-off information.  Contact your municipal recycling program for information on collection days scheduled for computers and televisions."

notes: The ReStore raises funds by selling merchandise and, after expenses, uses all profits to build more homes.  Habitat also provides families an opportunity to buy building materials that they may not otherwise be able to afford. This will help raise the standards of housing. By recycling goods that would have been sent to a landfill, the ReStore also helps reduce waste disposal costs. If you have materials to donate, please call for more information. The Habitat ReStore takes most materials and the staff will be glad to talk with you.
